pageContext.description: Thin and finely surfaced. Remarkably light for its size. Fine point. Edges sharp, slightly damaged. 2 dents in one face of socket. Barbs sharply pointed. Socket hollow well up blade; mouth broken.
pageContext.other: Width: blade 67mm; socket 26mm,Thickness: blade at section 11mm; socket 20mm (broken),Weight: 8 oz = 226.796 gms
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. II (1846), 187, Fig,S. Allies, Antiqs. of Worcs. (ed 2, 1856), 30, Fig. with refs,Evans, Anc. Br. Imps, 337, with refs,V.C.H. Worcs. I, 196
pageContext.collection: Cheltenham Museum,Jabez Allies Collection,Donor, Miss Allies,1940
pageContext.site: England,Worcestershire,Worcester County Borough,about 1 1/2 miles below Worcester and 1/2 mile below Diglis Lock, dredged from the Severn, 1844
pageContext.toSearch: 12 Armstrong Drive, Worcester, Worcestershire Wr1 2ga, UK
pageContext.remarks: Attached is a visiting card of the writer with record in ink: "Mr. J. Allies. Spear head dredged up from the bed of the Severn about a mile and a half below Worcester in 1844."
